content.question: Industrial logging threatens many forested ecosystems. Which of the following environmental consequences will most likely result from clear-cutting deciduous forests for logging?

choices.label: More carbon dioxide will be added to the atmosphere and increase anthropogenic climate change.
Farmers will be able to utilize more land, resulting in a decrease in the number of floods.
Less oxygen will be used by the trees, so more oxygen will be in the atmosphere for humans and other animals to use.
The regulating services of the area, such as nutrient cycling and water regulation, would increase with fewer trees in the landscape.

content.answer: More carbon dioxide will be added to the atmosphere and increase anthropogenic climate change.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
